title: Step Configuration
description: Event step that routes content based on AI analysis confidence scores to determine auto-action vs human review.

title: Input Schema
description: Complex schema that accepts AI analysis results including text analysis, image analysis, scores, and error states.

title: Confidence Thresholds
description: Configurable thresholds that determine auto-approval (≤5%), auto-rejection (≥95%), or human review (5-95%).

title: Auto-Approval Logic
description: Very low risk content (≤5%) is automatically approved without human intervention.

title: Auto-Rejection Logic
description: Very high risk content (≥95%) is automatically rejected without human intervention.

title: Human Review Routing
description: Uncertain content (5-95% risk) is routed to human moderators for review via Slack.

title: Decision Variables
description: Local variables that track the routing decision, confidence level, reason, and whether it's an automatic decision.

title: Reason Generation
description: Helper function that generates human-readable explanations for routing decisions based on analysis results.

title: Routing Decision Event
description: Emits content.needsReview event with routing decision and confidence information for the Slack notifier.

title: Confidence Calculation
description: Calculates confidence levels differently for auto-decisions vs human review needs.

title: Decision Logging
description: Logs routing decisions with submission ID, decision type, and confidence levels for audit trails.
